Package com.payd.shooti.entities

Class SimpleEntity

java.lang.Object
com.payd.shooti.math.Bounds
com.payd.shooti.entities.BoundsEntity
com.payd.shooti.entities.SimpleEntity
All Implemented Interfaces:
IBoundsObject, ICanShader, IDispose, IGameObject, IRender, IUpdate
Direct Known Subclasses:
ChildRoom, DynamicBuildingRowDarkener, DynamicRoomBackground, DynamicRoomWalls, FakeLight, GameCameraVignette, GameEntity, GameMapBackground, GameMapRoom, GxPatrolBotArm, NPCHand, ParallaxFullScreenLayer, PlayerHair, PlayerHand, PlayerHeadJewelry, PlayerSlottedWeapon, PlayerSubHand, PlayerTeamIndicator, PlayerUpperBody, PrefabRoomBackground, PrefabRoomBackgroundTile, PrefabRoomForeground, ProceduralRoomBackground, ProceduralRoomBackgroundTile.ProceduralRoomBackgroundTileAccent, ProceduralRoomDiscoverableTile, ProceduralTerrainExtendedGround, ProceduralTerrainTileAccent, SimpleRoomWalls, TextEntity, TiledRoomBackground, TiledRoomOverlay, TiledRoomParallaxGroup, TiledRoomParallaxGroup.ParallaxForegroundLayer, TiledRoomTerrain, TiledRoomWallFurniture, WeaponAttachment, WeaponCharmConnection, ZoneGameCapturePoint
public class SimpleEntity extends BoundsEntity implements IGameObject, ICanShader
SimpleEntity exists as a base class for entities which are not rendered in a manager and don't require server interpolation/identification, and/or exist as internals of other complex entity objects. SimpleEntity renders a GameSprite and exists as a BoundsEntity. It is not managed by the EntityManager. SimpleEntity has built-in alpha interpolation and removal functionality. Use show() and hide() to control alpha with interpolation. Use setAlpha(float) to set alpha immediately and halt all interpolation. Use fadeTo(float) to interpolate to a specific alpha. Functions with a delay parameter - fadeTo(float, float), hide(float), hideAndRemove(float), & showTemporarily(float) - all operate on the same stopwatch for delay. If a delay is already in progress, the delay will be reset by a subsequent call to any of these functions. Any of the alpha functions will reset the delay watch as well. If a SimpleEntity isAwaitingRemoval, show() call will be ignored. setAlpha(float) will still apply, however it will not stop the removal fade-out in progress.
Since:
1.0

    • startShader

      @Null public com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.glutils.ShaderProgram startShader(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.SpriteBatch batch)
      Description copied from interface: ICanShader
      Starts the internal ShaderProrgram to be applied on future render calls.

      Ends the SpriteBatch, and starts a new one with the ShaderProgram and matrix applied.

      Returns the ShaderProgram that was in use prior to the new shader being applied.
      Specified by:
      startShader in interface ICanShader
      Returns:
      batch.getShader() before applying. Returns null if ICanShader.hasShader() is false.

    • endShader

      public void endShader(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.SpriteBatch batch, com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.glutils.ShaderProgram originalShader)
      Description copied from interface: ICanShader
      Ends the ShaderProgram and SpriteBatch, and starts a new one with the original ShaderProgram applied.
      Specified by:
      endShader in interface ICanShader
      Parameters:
      batch - SpriteBatch which was present via batch.end(), before applying the new shader.
      originalShader - The original ShaderProgram which was present via batch.getShader(), before applying the new shader. This allows for the original shader to be applied back after the render functions are called.
